timeline.message:
Prevent misconfigurations for gRPC router

Motivation:

gRPC server allows users to register routes in different ways:
- using multiple instances of `ServiceFactory`;
- using `ServiceFactory.Builder` with different
`GrpcExecutionStrategy` configuration;
- using `ServiceFactory.Builder` with different API variants;

Users can accidentally misconfigure the router by registering
the same RPC more than once. Currently, gRPC server silently
overrides the old RPC with the new one. It may lead to
unexpected behavior in production and hard to diagnose issues.

Modifications:

- Throw `IllegalStateException` when users register an RPC for
the same path more than one time;

Result:

Users will be notified at the build time if they registered
multiple RPC implementations for the same path.

timeline.author: NiteshKant

timeline.bodyText:
It is somewhat non-intuitive that we are only checking for one alternative Map when we have 3 more Maps of routes.
Consider adding a comment to explain that we only assume duplication across blocking and async variant of the same API and not between scalar and streaming.
timeline.author: NiteshKant
